Package hu.klenium.tetris.logic.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.klenium.tetris.logic.board.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board is a grid, it stores fallen tetromino parts. Each game has one board, this is the main display area. When a tetromino can't move down any more, its parts are added to the board. These parts aren't moveable, the player can't control them in any ways. When a row of the board is full (ie. each cell contains a tetromino part), that row is removed, and every rows above it are moved down by one row.

    • Field Detail

      • gridSize

        private final Dimension gridSize
        Number of rows and columns of the grid.

      • grid

        private final BoardCell[][] grid
        Contains previously fallen tetrominoes' parts. A cell may be empty, ie. the cell doesn't contain any tetromino part (see EmptyBoardCell), or used/filled, when it stores one part (see FilledBoardCell). The falling tetromino's parts can't be moved over any used cells, a part can't overlap another part. When a tetromino lands (ie. can't move down anymore), its parts are added to the grid.
        This array is indexed by coordinates, first X, then Y. Its size is stored in gridSize.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board​(Dimension size)
        Initializes a new board for a new game.
        Parameters:
        size - The board's size (rows/columns).

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        Tells the board's size. It's used to calculate new falling tetrominoes' initial position (which is related to the board's centre).
        Returns:
        The board's size (rows/columns).
        See Also:
        gridSize

      • getGrid

        public BoardCell[][] getGrid()
        Gives access to the grid: used by view only!
        Returns:
        The board's grid.
        See Also:
        grid

      • canAddTetromino

        public boolean canAddTetromino​(Tetromino tetromino,
                               Point from)
        Checks if the tetromino in its current state (excluding its position) could be added to the grid at a specificed position.
        Parameters:
        tetromino - The tetromino which will be tested.
        from - Testing position from where the tetromino wanted to be added to the grid.
        Returns:
        If the tetromino's bounding box wouldn't fit into the grid, or at least one of the grid's cells which would be used by the tetromino isn't empty returns false, otherwise returns true.

      • addTetromino

        public void addTetromino​(Tetromino tetromino)
        Adds a landed tetromino's parts to the board. Empty cells will be replaced with filled cells. The tetromino should be destroyed after it is added to the board.
        Parameters:
        tetromino - The landed tetromino.

      • removeFullRows

        public void removeFullRows()
        Called when a tetromino lands, and so it's possible a row will be full. Full rows need to be removed from the board. If a row is removed, all other rows above it will be moved down one row too, and the upper row will be filled with empty cells.

      • isBoxInsideGrid

        private boolean isBoxInsideGrid​(Point boxPosition,
                                Dimension boxSize)
        Checks if a rectangle is inside the board's area. It is used to prevent invalid states of a tetromino, because they can't moved outside of the board.
        Parameters:
        boxPosition - The rectangle's top-left position.
        boxSize - The rectangle's size.
        Returns:
        True if the tetromino's rectangle is in the grid's rectangle, false otherwise.

      • isRowFull

        private boolean isRowFull​(int rowIndex)
        Determines whether the specified row is full.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The number of that row which is tested.
        Returns:
        True when at least one cell in that row is empty, or false if all cells are used.

      • moveDownBoardsUpperPart

        private void moveDownBoardsUpperPart​(int startRowIndex)
        Copies and adds new rows. When a row is removed from the board, each row above if will be moved down by one row, and each cells in the upper row will be replaced with empty cells. That's how Tetris works.
        Parameters:
        startRowIndex - The number (index) of the row which was/will be removed from the board.
